As the group continues on to the next town, Brock and Misty begin discussing what to do now. "Well, what's the point of continuing the journey? It's not like Ash can compete in the Johto League anymore. And I don't know about you, but I want to see my family again." Brock says.

Misty fumes. "Yeah, but this is Ash we're talking about! You know that he won't give up just because of this!" She looks around, a bit confused. "Speaking of Ash, where is he?"

"He and Pikachu have been spending a lot of time playing together. I think that they are closer than ever. The two are really bonding." Brock replies.

Little does Brock know, the kind of "playing" that Ash and Pikachu are doing is very different from what he has in mind. As Pikachu mounts Ash from behind again, she really begins to hate Lily for what's being done to her. She can't help it, she doesn't want her friend inside of her, but as a female Pokemon, she has animalistic needs, especially since she's in heat.

The worst part for her is that she enjoys her time with Pikachu. After all, her body is designed to love him. She welcomes him with a raised tail. All because of the stupid potion.

As the two reach climax together, Ash realizes that she is doomed to a life of being Pikachu's bitch. After all, Lily said she could never turn back.

Once they finish, the two electric rodents head back to the camp, where they find out that...

11123.content:
"It's possible to create a reverse potion. It will take time, but I have all of the necessary ingredients. However..." Lily hesitated.

"What? What's the problem?" Ash asked, still surprised at the sound of her voice.

"Well, this potion was made for me to drink, hence it turned you female. The reverse potion would make you a female version of yourself. Not only that, but there's a chance that it could alter reality, becoming permanent in the process."

Lily gave the transformed boy digest the information before continuing. "If it doesn't become permanent, I can try to turn you back into a Pikachu."

"What? Why would you do that?" Lily sighed. "There's a chance that could replicate the change in gender, giving you an opportunity to turn back into your original self. Or, it could just keep you as a female Pikachu, permanently." The magician shrugged. "We could also wait for a bit to increase the chances of you successfully returning to normal, but you'd have to be extremely careful during that period. If you were to evolve or get captured, you'd be stuck as a female Pikachu forever." Lily gave him a look." It's ultimately your choice, though.."

Everyone looked to Ash as she came to her decision. "Alright, I've decided to..."

Alright guys, if we stay out in the woods, there's less of a chANCE that something bad will happen." Brock suggested. "We should set up camp nearby, so we're close at hand when Lily finishes her potion." The others nodded.

Overhead, unnoticed by the group of young trainers, a cat-shaped balloon floated lazily on the breeze. "Oh, what's this? James exclaimed, looking down through a pair of binoculars. His partners in crime rushed to his side.

"What is it James?" Jessie asked excitedly. "James giggled with glee. "It is! A rare mint bottlecap! I must add it to my collection!"

"Huh, dat's odd. Dey's gots two Pikachus, and the one kid's missin'!" He leered at his companions. "You know what dat means, right?" The group burst into evil cackles.

Down below, Ash and co had reached the shore of a large lake and were busy setting up their equipment. Brock was currently working on cooking up some lunch, while Misty helped get the tents ready. 11123221.content:
Ash turned to see a trio of people, one much shorter than the others, approaching their camp. They were dressed like Park Rangers. She decided to head over and see what was up.

"Oh, hello!" Brock greeted the officials. The first one, a woman with long red hair, leaned down towards him. "What are you doing here? Don't you know that this area is a Pokemon reserve?"

Brock blinked, or would have if his eyes ever opened. "Huh?' Misty tilted her head in confusion. "What do you mean?"

The second member of the group, a tall man with purple hair, made a 'tsk tsk tsk' sound. "Kids these days..." He pulled out a shiny, official looking badge. "This area is off-limits due to poaching. Tell me, do you have permission from Park HQ to be here?" Both trainers shook their heads.

The short one pulled out a clipboard. "Lemme see, hm... Names?" The two young trainers gave him their names. He pulled on his moustache before looking at the two approaching Pikachu. "Are dese two your Pokemon?"

Ash wanted to speak up, but decided that a talking Pokemon might freak out the rangers. Brock responded for her. "They... Belong to a friend. We're just... Holding on to them for him."

Misty quickly nodded. "Yeah, that's right! His name is Ash." The tall man gave them a look of disbelief. "Oh really? Would you mind telling us where this 'Ash' is?" When neither responded, he pulled out something resembling a price tag scanner.

"H-hey! What are you going to do with that?!" The redheaded woman frowned. "Relax, girlie. That device scans for ownership info. If these two belong to your friend, they'll be registered to his Trainer Card. If you two are his friends, it will like list you as traveling companions."

The tall man knelt in front of Pikachu and held the trigger. A red beam flashed in the little rodent's eyes, blinding him momentarily. The device gave a beep, and the man inspected it. "Hm, Ash Ketchum of Pallet Town, age ten, seven Johto badges and eight Kanto badges. Starter Pokemon, Pikachu." He looked up to his partners. "This one checks out." He moved towards Ash.

It took all of her willpower not to run away as he scanned her. The man frowned as he looked at his device. "This one is wild. It's not registered to a Pokeball." Brock quickly tried to explain, but was silenced by the short man with a moustache. "Dirty thieves, eh? I'm not surprised."

"N-no, that's not it!" Misty cried, trying to come up with an explanation. "It's just- she wanted to join Ash, but he was out of Pokeballs!" Brock quickly caught on. "Yeah, that's why he's not here right now. You've got to believe us, please!"

The woman shook her head. "I'm afraid not. We'll be taking these two so we can get them back to where they came from, and we'll be taking you to jail." She sighed. Though I suppose if your 'friend' vouches for you when he shows up, we'll let you go."

The tall man picked up the two Pikachu as the woman handcuffed Brock. Just as she was about to handcuff Misty, the younger redhead lunged towards the tall man and...

11131.content:
Team Rocket were laughing as they uncovered their new morphing machine that was a present from the boss, its power was to turn Pokemon into their anthropomorphic (aka human) counterparts, via dna shifting. The shiny new machine gave a ding noise as it extended a silver vacuum chute to accept any medium sized pokemon, or at least 12 pokeballs.

"Oh Jessie," James said, "I can't wait to use it on a Pokemon!" Meowth looked aghast and ran a few metres away from the machine as it beeped once or twice behind the bushes. Meanwhile, a certain Pikachu was exploring the area of Saffron City with Ash as it scampered behind the Silph corporation building, where the machine was located. The leafy green bushes hid the location of the morphing machine well from the prying eyes of passerbys and Pikachu was sniffing around, curious as to what it had found.

"There it is!" exclaimed Jessie, "We have to catch it for the Boss!" Pikachu accidentally gave a shock as it accidentally activated the morphing machine. The machine shook and gave a loud beep as the evolution music started and Pikachu suddenly flashed white.

In a few seconds, the white glow subsided as Pikachu's form became more humanoid by the second. Yellow hair sprouted from its rodentine form, human skin soon replaced its fur, and it grew taller by the minute. Soon, a teenage girl would be seen in the bushes as its blond hair would be seen easily. Brown eyes would blink as she spoke
"Pika?" the teenage girl said, as Jessie was astounded by the change.

"James! What have you done?! This Pokemon had evolved into a human form!" Jessie roared at James.

11133222413.content:
"Hey! Quit it!" Lusamine whines with a voice still unfamiliar to her. To say that her life has become a nightmare is an understatement. In the few hours since she had woken up and found out about her new body, Lillie had refused to leave her alone as if she could not take care of herself. Not even Wicke is willing to take her seriously and is more than happy to treat her like she really is a little girl, though at least for now she is still the Aether President by proxy. Being only half of the other girl's size, she can only complain as Lillie dresses her with her frilly hand-me-downs. "Don't you have anything that looks less childish?"

"Nope, sorry," Lillie continues dressing her. "These were the only type of clothes you ever let me wear at that age. Don't worry, though. You look very cute."

"I don't want to be cute!" Lusamine stomps at the ground in frustration. "I'm your mother and I demand respect."

"Oh, now you want to be my mom? For a while now, I just saw a little girl throwing a tantrum who needs to treat her elders with respect. It's only now that your body matches your mind." Lillie states bluntly as she quickly brushes the smaller girl's hair. Lusamine, shocked and even hurt that Lillie would say that, is stunned into silence. Ever since Lillie has found her backbone and has become twice her size, she has become rather nervous towards her. Not to mention, considering her past mistakes, she can't exactly say that Lillie is wrong to be upset at her either. After all her former daughter had been through, she was not going to be able to get Lillie to forgive her that easily and being regressed cements the idea that she may never have a second chance to be a good mother for her.

"...I'm sorry." Lusamine looks down at the ground timidly trying to hold back her tears. Lillie, having finished braiding her hair, kneels down and gives her a hug, something she cannot help but admit she finds comforting despite the circumstances.

"It's okay, sweetie. Your big sister loves you very much." Lillie picks her up and carries her like a cherished stuffed animal. Lusamine just pouts, figuring she will just have to accept it, though she is not sure how much further patronizing she can take. At that moment, Wicke storms into the room and informs her that ___.

choices: Bulma (in the Namekian frog's body) suddenly jumps and takes the hit!
Ginyu (in Bulma's body) takes the hit!
115331222222222121.content:
Bulma, now in the body of a Namekian frog, looks on as Ginyu, who have recently steal Bulma's original body, takes off on her air-ski. She looks at her slimy little body in fear, sadness and disgust.

Ever since she arrived on Namek with the boys, her time on the planet have been absolutely terrible so far. From meeting an alien foot soldier who she find charming at first, whose true form was...something she rather not talk about again, to getting left behind in the cave, to that incident with the crab and one of the Dragon Balls, and just getting chased off by dinosaurs to add to the fact.

And as if she can't ask for anything worse then that, come an alien frog, who somehow have body snatching power, and took off with her own body and ran!

Needless to say, Bulma just have enough of this.

"That does it!" croaked Bulma as she swore. "I have had it with this planet! I'm going to find that crook, find my body and get me off of this planet! I don't want to be a little frog for the rest of my life!" She sighed. "Well, at least he was kind to...huh?! The translator! It's gone!" Bulma said, as she looked all over her to see if it still on her.

To her shock, it's not. The translator must of had slipped off of her body when she lands hard to the ground.

"Oh no, that must means...he had it with him!" cried out Bulma. "I have to catch up with that fiend if I ever want to get back to normal!"

---------------------------

Meanwhile, Ginyu, in Bulma's body, is en route to the battlefield on Bulma's old air-ski, where Lord Frieza awaits.

"Hah hah hah! What a woman! To think that I really gave her a second chance like that! Hah! The look on her face was priceless!" Ginyu gloats as he drived and steered.

"Plus, I even managed to snatch that device when I trashed the little slimeball to the ground, like a worm! Still though, I could sure use a better body myself, these lumps here ain't gonna do me no good." He said, just before a frog jumps on the front of the air-ski. "What the?! It's you!" yelled out Ginyu.

"Alright, you damn pervert, your going to give me back my body and that translator right this instant!" Bulma-Frog croaked. "How about a little of this instead?!" Ginyu said, as he rams the air-ski to a nearly wall of a mountain in hoping that Bulma-Frog will get splattered by it. But luckily, Bulma-Frog is still hanging on the air-ski.

"Rrrgh! Hold still, you little---" said Ginyu, before he get cut short by Bulma sticking his tongue at Ginyu's eye. "---AAAAAUUUUGGHH! MY EEEYYYEEE!"Ginyu screamed, as he loose control of his steering, and crashed on the ground, right at the heart of the battlefield, where Son Goku's epic battle with Frieza is taking place.

---------------------------

Goku's son, Gohan, one of his best friends, Krillin, and his once-rival Piccolo are watching on from the sidelines as speculators, but not before Ginyu and Bulma crashed on the ground, leading the trio to come to "Bulma's" aid. Son Goku and Frieza overheard the crash, as their battle comes to a halt. "What the devils is going on down there now?" thought Frieza, having recently been powered up to his final form, and is using 30% of his power.

Realizing that Frieza has stopped the fighting, so does Son Goku, as they both looks down to see the commotion from the sidelines.

"That's it! I had it with this slimy bastard! I'm going to stomp you out into toad..." Ginyu stopped midway before turning over to a confused Gohan and Krillin, and a highly suspicious Piccolo. "...uh, hey guys! It's me, uh, Bulma!" He said in a higher pitch, trying his best to impersonate Bulma, albeit, pathetically poorly at that.

"Oh hey Bulma, are you okay? That must of been a rough landing you got there." asked Krillin. "Also, what's up with your voice there? And that frog you got on your hands?" "Oh, erm, I-" said Ginyu before Bulma croaks. "No! Don't listen to him! I'm the real Bulma! You guys have to believe me!"

"Now hold on here, Krillin. Something doesn't seems right with Bulma." said Piccolo as he gives a suspicious grin. "Especially the way her voice is now..."

"Alright, what the hell is the meaning of all this?" asked Frieza as he lowers himself into the sidelines. "We were just in the middle of our battle before that blue-haired monkey and her miserable toad interrupted all of it."

"Huh, what is goin' on, you guys?" added Son Goku.

Ginyu tossed the frog aside as he approaches Frieza. Gohan would see the poor frog being flung before he flies up and caught it. "Lord Frieza, it is but I, Captain Ginyu! I have returned to you to follow all orders as you commanded!" said Ginyu in his real voice, leaving the group, excluding Bulma and Frieza, who is merely surprised, shocked.

"G-G-Ginyu?! Didn't Goku took care of this guy and the Ginyu Force already?!" yelled out a nerving Krillin, as he steps back a little.

Ginyu nods, before he glanced at Goku from up above. "Indeed, your friend Goku may of had killed off all four of my men, however, I was far ahead of my death. For you see, I was just about close to switch bodies with Vegeta, before that Goku threw a frog and made me what I made your friend now!" He glanced at Bulma-Frog, giving a devious smirk, nerving Bulma.

"Now hold on! If you are just so happen to be in Bulma's body, wouldn't that make Bulma---" Piccolo added, before being rudely interrupted by Ginyu. "---the frog the little brat is holding? Like you would of all knew by now. It's just that obvious!" Ginyu said, grinning.

"Oh man, poor Bulma..." Gohan said, having just caught on, holding Bulma-Frog gently in his hands.

"Well, as much of a tale this has all been, I hate to break it up that you have finally outlived your usefulness, Captain Ginyu." Frieza said.

"W-What?!? But Lord Frieza, you just can't do this to me!" said Ginyu. "Well, ain't that too bad for you. In that case, you'll gladly be the first victim to die before me! If you can't just accept your uselessness to me, we'll might as well make this dying planet your rotting grave!" said Frieza as he readies a Death Beam at Ginyu's possessed body.

"No, Frieza! Don't do it! If you do it now, then there is no reason left to get Bulma back in her body! So please, in the name of all the good people you have killed on Namek, don't!" protested Goku.

Though he knows that Captain Ginyu was far from being a good guy, taking his body as possession earlier and almost taking Vegeta's body for himself, who the latter have just died in front of Goku recently, and that he serves under Frieza's own rules, Ginyu was far from being as half the menace then Frieza is, given that he has a life with the Ginyu Force underneath his cold heart.

But what's more important is that he is in the possession of Bulma's body. The very first friend that Goku have ever met in his journey, long before Piccolo, Gohan, and even Krillin, back when he was a little boy. To see Bulma, nor anyone else getting hurt in any size or form would take someone this ruthless and heartless to go through.

And to Frieza, this was no exception.

"Oops, I think I let this one slipped." said Frieza sarcastically, as despite Goku's warnings, he fires it anyway.

"FRIEZA, NOOOOOO!!!" screamed Goku.

11533222211.content:
In the East Blue, in the middle of the night, a lone barrel floats down the ocean. On the barrel is a poorly drawn skull bearing a Straw Hat and a pair of wings. The barrel begins to crack as the night's sky shines on it. Out comes a purple hand ending in several claws. Out from the barrel arises a strange winged creature that lets out a yawn. "Huh?" asks the creature. "Dammit, I overslept again! Wait! Where's my... oh yeah, I sailed right into a whirlpool. Oh well."

As our confused protagonist flaps his wings and flies off into the air, he places a straw hat upon his head as the moonlight reveals his true face. It is Monkey D. Luffy, a boy who turned into a winged creature of the night upon eating the Garg-Garg Fruit (Gagu Gagu no Mi). Luffy is currently the only member of what will become the infamous Straw Hat Pirates and seeks out the fabled treasure known as One Piece, with which to become the pirate king.

Of course, there is something else on our hero's mind. "I'm hungry. There's got to be a restaurant here somewhere." Unfortunately for our straw hat friend, in this universe, the Baratie is in the North Blue. But all is not lost for Luffy for below him sails a pirate ship. A pirate ship bearing a Jolly Roger with an apple and a cross shaped pair of bones. "I wonder if they have any food on that ship down there." Says Luffy as he flaps his wings down.

What Luffy, simple-minded fool that he is in any universe, doesn't know is that the pirate ship below belongs to the infamous pirate captain "Poison-Apple" Shirohime, a ruthless pirate (as far as East Blue pirates go) with a bounty of 10,000,000 beli. Surely, Luffy will find more than just food there.

125121.content:
Equestria has been a chaotic dystopia for over a thousand years. The sun and moon was constantly changing, the roads were slippery, Cloudsdale is in ruins and most of the ponies were insane. It was like a wonderland for psychos. It seemed like nothing could stop Discord and all hope was lost but all of that was about to change...

**************

A small orange filly was busy sobbing to herself in the darkness. She was still a sane filly but she had lost everything to Discord. Her parents, her friends and everypony she knew has turned insane but somehow she knew she had to keep strong. She knew it was the only way to keep her from going insane. After a few minutes, she decided to feel her surroundings around her. Using her sense of touch, she felt some damp rocky surfaces and found herself to be in the middle of a deep cave.

"That's just great! I'm going to die of hunger if I don't get out of here!" she yelled to herself not knowing which way she came in from.

"No kidding!" replies an unknown but familar voice in the darkness. She can see a mysterious figure across the distance. Scootaloo trembled in fear as the figure was getting closer to her.

"Who are you?" she asked, suddenly shaking with fear. The figure moved closer to reveal...
125121.title: The Start of a New Story

1251211.content:
The figure turned out to be a small purple and green dragon that the orange filly knew very well. The dragon walked towards the filly and hugged her tightly. The filly didn't know what to do in the situation, all she could think of was to let him cuddle her. A couple of seconds later, the dragon decided to try and start a conversation with the only pony he could see.

"Hi Scootaloo..." the small dragon muttered, "Why did you decide to hide here?"

"It was in the Everfree Forest," Scootaloo quietly replied, "I knew nopony would be able to hurt or find me. It's been over a week since I stayed here. Everypony I knew... is gone."

"You still have me... Scoots," the dragon said in a relaxed voice. An awkward silence soon followed for a moment as Scootaloo started to hug the dragon for emotional comfort. The dragon could hear Scootaloo crying so he hugged her harder.

"Thanks for the support Spike." Scootaloo sobbed, still cuddling Spike, "I don't know what would've happen if you weren't here now. I probably end up going insane."

Moments passed as the two kept on hugging each other causing an still silence in the air. A few minutes later, they both started to stop cuddling each other and decided to plan on what to do next. They could either stay in the cave but they would probably starve to death unless they ate rocks which is what dragons eat. They could also try and leave the cave, but it's completely dark and it might get themselves more deep into the cave.

What do they decide?
1251211.title: Spike the Dragon

12512112.content:
The both of them decided on leaving this cave. The only problem was that the cave was completely dark and that they might get completely lost. Luckily, Spike was a dragon so he could breathe fire. All he needed to do was find a large stick to make a torch. He looked around for a few seconds before finding a big enough stick to use as the torch. He blew out fire from out of his nose and onto the torch.

"Done!" Spike proudly exclaimed to himself. He and Scootaloo were now walking away from the area they were once in and into a narrow passage with the torch clutched in Spike's hand. It was a long trip and nothing interesting happened along the way except for a weird looking treasure chest that was leaning on one side which Scootaloo picked up. When they reached the entrance of the cave, Spike noticed that Scootaloo was carrying a chest of some sort.

"Uh... Scootaloo," Said Spike, "Where did you get that? I've got a key that Twilight gave me earlier but it didn't unlock anything."

"Found it in the cave," replied Scootaloo before she turned enthusiastic, "Let's try the key on the chest!"

And so they did. The chest unlocked itself and opened to reveal five golden necklaces and one golden tiara that represented the Elements of Harmony. The chest also contained a strange bottle with a green liquid inside of it. On the bottle, was the words 'Cure' on it. They couldn't believe their eyes. They knew that justice was going to come back. All they had to do was get the six ponies who represent their element. But where were they?

125332222221.title: Role Reversal

1253322222211.content:
Penny: A young and and upcoming physicist. She worked at a small, private college in Nebraska until a revolutionary breakthrough landed her a job at Caltech. While her social skills are a bit lacking and often gets frustrated with others who do not have as high an IQ, her heart is usually in the right place. While her apartment was meant to be a temporary home until she got situated in Pasadena she has lived there for almost five years, despite her common complaints if being surrounded by idiots.

Leonard: An all star athlete, and team captain and quarterback of the football team throughout high school and college, Leonard narrowly missed making it into the NFL something he has still not managed to quite get over. He ended up becoming high school Social Studies teacher so that he is able to coach the football team. At five foot ten inches he is slightly taller than normal, and is quite the looker. He shares an apartment with Sheldon, and often has to look out for his roommate and bail him out of trouble. He and Penny have started to develop feelings for each other, though neither will admit it.

Sheldon: An amateur bodybuilder, Sheldon is dumb muscle of the group. His strength is only matched by the size of his ego, something that consistently gets him in to trouble and one of the reasons he has as of yet been unable to keep a steady job. He dropped out of school as soon as he could, much to the dismay of his devout Catholic mother who had hoped he would join the priesthood, and is currently making ends meet by working as a bouncer at a local nightclub and sharing an apartment with Leonard. He is also a bit of a womanizer, though this has tones down some since he started dating Amy. People often wonder why his friends put up with him, something they themselves still wonder as well. The Lazy boy in front of the TV in his and Leonard's apartment is his lucky chair, which he won't let anyone else sit in.

Howard: At over six feet tall most people are surprised to find that Howard doesn't play professional basket ball, and even more surprised to find out he is Jewish. Howard have up the chance to play in college in order to stay home and help his mother care for his aging father. His insistence on keeping Jewish law often annoys his friends - especially Sheldon - but he is a vial part of the group.

1551324111.content:
"So you think we can get anything for it?", Katniss asked as she examined the necklace they had found in the woods after their morning hunt. It was silver, and had a pendent, with swirls that formed two separate circles across from each other.

"Probably not, it not like there are that many uses for jewelry around here.", Gale said. It was true, it's not like there were any fancy parties in District 12, and the richer people in the district probably wouldn't want something so small and simple. "Why don't you give it to Prim?"

"Jewelry isn't really our thing.", Katniss said. As they walked towards the Hob to trade with Greasy Sae, they passed by a group of young innocent children who were playing, making Katniss remember her own childhood, a childhood that was cut short, when her father had died in a mining accident. It also made her think of Gale's baby sister, Posy, who had never known her father, and had become like a second sister to her. "What about Posy? Do you think she would like the necklace?"

"Yeah, she might.", Gale responded.

"We'll then here, you should give it to her.", Katniss said offering the necklace to Gale.

"Nah, you found it, you should give it to her.", Gale said.

"You sure?", Katniss asked.

"Yeah she loves it when you come over.", Gale said.

"Alright.", Katniss said, looking forward to seeing Posy.

\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\

After trading with Greasy Sae, the two headed towards the Hawthorne house, so Katniss could give Posy the necklace.

"Hey, Katniss and I are back.", Gale called out as the two entered the house.

Moments later, Posy ran into the room, and jumped into Katniss's arms. "CATNIP", Posy exclaimed, calling Katniss by the nickname only she and her oldest brother used for her.

"Hey there Posy.", Katniss said cheerfully.

"Are you going to spend the day with us.", Posy asked.

"Sorry, I have to go home soon, but here I have something for you.", Katniss said then set her down, before pulling out the necklace then kneeled down to show it to her.

"It's pretty.", Posy said amazed, with all the innocence possible for someone in a world like this.

"I thought you might like it, turn around, so I can put it on you.", Katniss said, and when she did, she felt a small shock, but passed it off as nothing.

Posy then turned around and wrapped her small arms around Katniss's neck, giving her as tight of a hug as she could manage. "Thank you Catnip."

"No problem.", Katniss said hugging her back.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// ///////////////////////////////////////////////

After returning home, doing her chores and spending time with Prim, by the end of the day Katniss was exhausted was happy to get some sleep. Just like most night Prim eventually slips into your bed, and snuggles into you, while you hold her.

Then next morning you

15513241111.content:
As Katniss began to wake, she felt two arms wrapped around her, she was being help close to someone, its was comfortable. Barely opening her eyes, Katniss untangled herself from the nearby body, and stretched her arms out, before letting out a small yawn. Still sleepy, she didn't even notice the fact that her legs no longer reached the floor, while she sat at the edge of the bed. After getting down, she walked towards the toilet, rubbing the sleep out of her eyes as she did so. Once she was there, and closed the door, she finally saw her reflection in the mirror and let out a small yelp.

Reflection: http://photo.ma-bimbo.com/fr/56/27929/av...

She was a little kid, she looked no older than Posy, she wasn't even wearing the clothes she had worn to bed the previous night, she was instead wearing a large T shirt, probably one of Prim's. Touching her face, she couldn't believe it, she looked just like she had when Prim was born. Before she could do anything, there was a knock at the door.

"Catnip, are you ok?", she heard Prim ask.

Surprised to hear Prim use that nickname, and by her current situation. Not sure how Prim would react, Katniss remained quiet, and after a few seconds the door opened. There stood Prim, her normal 12 year old self, she then knelt down to your level, acting like nothings wrong. "What are you doing up so early, you should still be in bed.", Prim said.

Not sure what to say, Katniss looked around the room, outside the window, she could see that it was early, but it appeared to be the normal time that she woke up for a hunt. Before she could say anything Prim lifted Katniss into her arms and carried her back down the hall. "Come on back to bed."

"Prim someth-", Katniss stopped when she heard her squeaky voice.

"We'll talk later, I can already tell, your still sleepy", Prim said. It was true, while usually, Katniss would usually be able to get up at this time easily, her now smaller body seemed to lack the strength to stay awake and her eyes began close, while she unconsciously rested her head on Prim's shoulder. Prim then laid Katniss back in bed, before getting in herself, and held Katniss close, just as Katniss had done only the night before, and after a minute Katniss was once again asleep, hoping that this would turn out to be nothing but a dream.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// /////////////////////////////////////////

As Katniss woke up again, she noticed the sheets that she laid in seemed wet. As Katniss sat up, she noticed that Prim was no longer in bed with her, and that it was bright outside. Confused, she looked around the room and spotted her reflection in the mirror, and saw that she had the necklace that she had given to Posy, was now around her neck. Realizing that it was no dream, and that the wetness of blanket was probably from her after Prim had returned her to bed, without using the toilet, Katniss screamed.

Within moment her mother rushed into the room and knelt down in front of her. "Sweetie what's wrong, did something happe-", her mother stopped when she felt the sheets "Oh, it's ok sweetie, it's just an accident.", she said in a calming voice, before lifting Katniss off the bed, and onto the floor, then gathered the soiled sheets. "Now come on, let's clean you up", she then offered Katniss her hand. Not sure what else she could do Katniss took it, and followed her mother to the kitchen, where she began to heat up water.

"Now let's get you out of those clothes", she said, then began to pull the shirt over her daughter's head, while Katniss resisted, not wanting to be naked in the middle of the kitchen, where anyone could walk in. "Now come on sweetie, I know it's cold, but I need to clean you.", her mother said, and after a moment managed to get the shirt off, then her underwear. She then wrapped Katniss in a clean blanket, while they waited for the water to finish heating up.

While waiting, Katniss noticed that Prim wasn't around. "Where's Prim?", she asked, in her now squeaky voice.

"She's with the Hawthorne's like she always is honey.", her mother said. Figuring that she was with Rory and Vick, she didn't ask anymore questions.

Once the water was heated, her mother dropped her into the small tub and began to scrub her skin. While embarrassing, the water did seem nice. Being the older child, she usually went after Prim, when the water had already cooled down, it had been years since she had a warm bath.

A few minutes later, the door opened, Katniss covered herself as best she could, and looked to see who it was. It was Prim, and to her surprise was wearing their father's old hunting jacket, it hung loosely over her thin frame.Spotting you in the tub, she seemed surprised, then walked over, placing a bag on the counter. "Hey Catnip, I brought something for you.", Prim said, using that nickname again, then turned to their mother. "Why is Catnip taking a bath so early?"

"Oh it was nothing. your sister just had a little accident?", Their mother whispered, but loud enough for Katniss to hear, causing her more embarrassment.

Prim nodded, then knelt down to place a kiss on Katniss's head "I'll give you, your treat when your done.", she said.

Once Katniss was done, her mother dried her off, and put her in a dress, something she rarely wore, then placed her on a stool near the table, while she prepared breakfast.

Prim going through her bag, and brought out a much smaller bag, and handed it to Katniss "Here Catnip, just for you.", Prim said. When Katniss looked inside, she saw blueberries , as she pulled one out Prim stopped her. "Remember, those are for later."

After breakfast, their mother had work to do, and asked Prim to take Katniss outside for a while, then Prim

155132411111.content:
Taking Katniss by the hand, Prim took her outside. Hoping that she would be taken to the Hawthorne's home, Katniss did not resist and followed, but before they could head there, a group of young children ran past them, playing a game of tag. "Hey Catnip", one of them said as they ran off. Katniss couldn't believe it, her mother and sister acted like nothing was wrong, as if she had always been a 4 year old little girl, and now little kids were treating her as if they knew each other, and everyone was calling her by that childish nickname.

"Wan't to go play with your friends Catnip?", Prim asked, as she ran her hand through Katniss's hair.

"But what about Po-", Katniss said, but was cut off when a young girl ran up to her, and tapped her on the arm.

"Tag your it.", the little girl said. It was one of Posy's friends, Lily, who was now the same age as Katniss, but slightly taller. "Come on we have to find everyone else.", she said taking Katniss by the hand and and began to run off. Being too weak to resist, Katniss followed, struggling to keep up with the girl, she had occasionally looked after, while spending time with Posy. When she looked back, Prim was already gone, probably inside of the Hawthorne house.

After a few minutes of following Lily, Katniss forgot about her current situation and actually had fun, chasing after other children, tagging them, before running off to find others. In between rounds of tag, Katniss shared her blue berries with Lily, not caring about her now muddy dress, or even thinking of her current state.

As the next round began, it was Katniss's turn to count, while the other's ran away. Not paying attention to wear she was running, Katniss ran into someone, causing her to fall to the ground,dirtying her dress even more. "OW", Katniss said, then looked up, it was someone she didn't recognize, she was Katniss's former age.

"Are you OK? You should be more careful when you are running Catnip.", the girl asked, kneeling down and helping her up. She seemed familiar.

"Yeah i'm fine.", Katniss said quietly, looking at the ground, remembering her situation, and embarrassed by the fact that she had just spent ,most of the day playing with a bunch of little kids.

"That's good.", the girl said as she patted Katniss down, trying to remove as much dirt as possible, "Your wearing the necklace I gave you.", she said holding the pendent in her hand.

"POSY!", Katniss said in shock, realizing that the young woman in front of her was the little girl, who had run into her arms, only the day before.

"Yeah, what?" Posy asked.

Before Katniss could say anything, the two heard Gale call out. "Posy come on.", he said. Katniss looked over to him in shock, everything seemed exactly the same as it did the day before, the only two exceptions being her and Posy, who appeared to have switched ages, and nobody except Katniss, not even Posy herself seemed to notice.

"I'm coming!", Posy called back to him, then turned back to Katniss. "Sorry I can't stay Catnip, Gale and me need to see Greasy Sae.", Posy said before kissing Katniss on her head, then stood back up and began to walk towards Gale.

"But..but", Katniss said in shock.

"Don't worry, we can play when I get back", Posy said before she and Gale walked off to the Hob. Leaving Katniss standing there stunned.

Not sure what to do Katniss then

1551324111111.content:
Standing there, Katniss realized how late it was now, she really had spent a whole day, playing games with a bunch of little kids, instead of providing for her mother and sister as she normally did. Before she could even move, she suddenly heard voices of parents calling out to their children, to return to their homes, probably for dinner.

"See you tomorrow Catnip.", Lily said as she ran past Katniss, into the arms of her father.

"Bye.", Katniss said as she tried to figure out how this could have caused this. Why had she and Posy switched places, and why was she the only one who remembered.

"Catnip, your a mess.", Katniss heard Prim say, snapping her out of her thoughts. Katniss then turned around, seeing Prim run up to her. Kneeling down, Prim examined Katniss, "Look at you, you dirtied your dress, your face is covered in dirt and you have a scrape on your face.", she said, then took Katniss by the hand, leading her back to their house. "Come on, we need to clean you up before dinner."

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// ////////////////////////////////////////////

When the two had gotten home, their mother was understandably upset, but as she was busy cooking, she simply told Prim to take Katniss to their room and clean her up. No matter how many times Katniss saw her new reflection, she could still not believe it. seeing her current appearance, caused her to think back to the vague memories she had of her childhood, playing with Madge and a few other kids, and how her father or mother would usually have to clean her up after.

After a minute Prim entered the room, holding a rag, and a bowl of warm water. She then sat down, and began to wipe the dirt from Katniss's face. "You should really be more careful Catnip, I don't want anything to happen to you.", Prim said.

"Sorry.", Katniss said, remembering how worried she would get whenever Prim got even the smallest cut.

Prim let out a huff, "It's ok, just be careful from now on.", she said. After cleaning the dirt off Katniss's face, Prim applied a band aid to her cheek, where the scrape was. "Now arms up, you cant eat it a dirty dress."

Not wanting to be undressed by her little sister, Katniss crossed her arms, "No.", Katniss said.

Thinking that this was nothing more than a child playing games, Prim tickled her sides, causing Katniss to uncross her arms, and giggle, giving Prim the chance to pull the dress over her head, before replacing it with another oversized shirt, similar to the one she was wearing that morning. "Now come on, its time to eat.", Prim said as she rolled the long sleeves up her sister's tiny arms.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// ////////////////////////////////////////////

After dinner Katniss was feeling tired, so Prim decided to take her to their room, "Sleep tight Catnip.", Prim said as she tucked her sister in, then noticed Katniss still had her necklace on. "You're lucky you didn't loose this today.", she said then removed it from Katniss's neck, and placed it on a nearby table. "Wouldn't want anything to happen to it, the day after Posy gave it to you.".

"wh...Pos...", Katniss tried to say, as she drifted off to sleep.

15513241111111.content:
As Katniss awoke the next morning, her mind felt clouded. Reaching out for warmth, Katniss discovered that Prim was no longer next to her, causing her to sit up. Katniss let out a tiny yawn, sleepily looking around the room for her big sister. When she saw her reflection in the mirror, she saw nothing wrong with it, but for reasons unknown to her, something seemed off. After climbing down the side of her bed, Katniss left the room, heading towards the kitchen, where she found her mother cooking.

"Mama.", Katniss said as she rubbed the sleep from her eyes.

Turning around, her mother saw her. "What are you doing up so early sweetheart?", she asked in a sweet tone, before picking Katniss up and placing her on a stool by the table.

"Where's Prim?", Katniss asked.

"She's with Gale and Posy., but she'll be back soon.", she said as she brought a small plate of food over to her daughter. "For now, just eat."

As Katniss finished eating, Prim entered the house, she quietly walked over, placing a kiss on Katniss's head. "Hi Catnip.", she said quietly, before sitting down. Her mother then placed a plate of food in front of her.

"Worried about today?", their mother asked, now seeming a bit sad.

Prim simply nodded, before beginning to eat her food.

"What's wrong Prim?", Katniss innocently asked, not knowing what today was.

"It's nothing.", Prim said, not really paying attention.

"Katniss why don't you get dressed, and go play with your friends.", their mother said, not wanting Katniss to hear their conversation.

Katniss quickly jumped off her stool and ran to her room, putting on a pink dress, shoes, and the necklace she had given posy two days ago. Looking at it, she couldn't help but feel that something was wrong.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// //////////////////////////////////////////////////

While playing tag with Lily and the other young children, they were interrupted by a large crowd of older children and teens walking by. Katniss noticed that Prim was among them, but was unable to get to her, so once they passed, the children returned to their game. While searching for other children, Katniss had tripped, as she sat up, her necklace slipped out from under her dress, and as she looked at the pendent again, she finally realized what was wrong.

'Oh no, its reaping day and I'm a little kid.', Katniss thought, as she looked around for her sister. Realizing she must be at the Reaping already, Katniss ran towards where the event was being held. When she got there she could see Prim. While making her way through the crowd, towards her sister, Katniss heard what she feared.

"Primrose Everdeen.", the woman announced. as Katniss continued to make her way to her sister, the woman continued to encourage Prim to come up. When Katniss got to the front of the crowd, she saw her shocked sister standing there, and as the guards attempted to escort Prim to the stage, Katniss did the only thing she could do in her state.

"Prim!", Katniss called out as she ran to her sister, holding onto her leg, not wanting anything to happen to her. As the guards tried to separate the two a voice called out.

"I volunteer as Tribute.", she said. As Katniss turned to see who it was, she saw Posy standing with her head held high.

Next

155132411111111.content:
Katniss sat with her sister at city hall, waiting to see Posy before she was sent to the capital. While she waited Katniss studied the necklace.

'I gave this to Posy, two days ago, now I have it, and i'm four years old while she's sixteen, maybe if I give it back to her, everything will be back to normal', Katniss thought.

A few minutes passed when Gale returned from his visit with Posy, they could tell he had been crying. "You two can go see her now.", Gale said, putting on a brave face.

Taking Katniss's hand Prim led her into the room, Posy was sitting there, looking worriedly at the ground.

"I'm sorry.", Prim said, not sure what else she could say.

Looking over to the Everdeen's, Posy quickly got up, and went up to them, enveloping both in a hug. "It's ok, I would do anything to keep you two safe.", Posy said sadly, not sure if she would ever see the two girls she considered her sisters again. Letting go, Posy directed Prim to a chair for her to sit, then lifted Katniss onto her lap, while she sat across from Prim.

Knowing that they wouldn't believe her, Katniss chose to play the innocent little girl, and waited for an opportunity to give Posy the necklace.

"Tell them you change your mind and I'll go.", Prim said.

"I'm not doing that.", Posy said, as she held Katniss close.

"What about your brothers?", Prim asked.

"They have Gale, but your all Katniss has.", Posy said. then took Prim's hand, "I promise i'm going to do whatever I have to do, to get back to all of you."

"Thank you.", Prim said, her voice cracking as she failed held back tears.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// //////////////////////////////////////////////////

As Katniss hugged Posy goodbye, she noticed Madge's mocking jay pin on Posy's dress. Seeing this as an opportunity to get back to her own age, Katniss played up her supposed innocence.

"What's that.", Katniss asked, acting a if, she did not know what was about to happen.

"Oh, that, it's a mocking jay, my friend Madge gave it to me.", Posy explained.

"Why?", Katniss asked.

"That's just what people do when, their friends are going away?", Posy said.

"Oh.", Katniss said then took her chance, removing the necklace and held it out to Posy. "Here."

"Catnip you don't have to give me anything,", Posy said.

"I want to.", Katniss said as sweetly as possible.

Posy then took the necklace and put it around her neck, then gave Katniss a tight hug. "I'll make sure to bring this back to you."

As Prim and Katniss left the room, Katniss looked back hoping that, the next morning, everything would be back to normal, even if it meant she would be fighting in the hunger games.

The next morning
155132411111111.title: Katniss thinks she can switch back

choices: Continue as the Games go on
1551324111111111.content:
Waking up, Katniss stretched her arms, not really paying attention to her surroundings and let out a yawn.She then saw her reflection in the mirror, nothing had changed, she was still a four year old little girl, which meant that Posy was still going into the Hunger Games.

'Maybe there is no going back', Katniss thought, then let out a small huff.

Looking around the room she was in, Katniss realized that she was no longer in the room that she and Prim shared, it wasn't even a room she had seen before.

"What are you doing up so early Katniss?", a sweet voice asked tiredly, looking to the other side of the bed, she saw who it was, she had been sleeping next to Gale's mother, Hazelle Hawthorne.

'Why am I here? Where's Prim?', Katniss thought, before she could actually ask anything, Hazelle reached forward, and pulled Katniss close to her, holding her close.

"Back to bed sweetie, you don't want to be tired later on.", Hazelle said.

"Bu-but.", Katniss tried to protest.

"Shhh...", Hazelle said, laying back down with Katniss held close, as she sang a small lullaby, causing Katniss to drift back to sleep.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// /////////////////////////////////////////

A few hours later Katniss woke up again, Hazelle had already left the room. When she exited the room, Rory and Vick ran passed her, chasing each other. Once again nobody except her seemed to notice anything was different. What shocked Katniss even more was when she saw a picture on the wall, it looked just like how it did, all the previous times she had seen it, the only difference was that Posy was nowhere to be seen, in her place was a young Katniss.

'I can't believe it, i'm still a little kid and now I've taken Posy's place. But if i'm there, where is she?', Katniss thought.

"Boy's breakfast is ready. Gale wake up your sister.", Katniss heard Hazelle call out from the kitchen.

As Katniss was about to head to the kitchen, a pair of arms lifted her off the ground. It was Gale, who then placed her on his shoulders. Katniss was really getting tired of people doing that.

"She's already up mom.", Gale said walking into the kitchen.

"Put her down Gale, you'll drop her.", Hazelle demanded.

"Alright, alright.", Gale said, bring Katniss down and putting her on a stood by the table, with a bowl of food in front of her.

After eating, Gale stayed to wash dishes, while Vick and Rory took Katniss outside. Seeing the other children playing, Katniss felt a strange need to follow. Luckily moments later Lily ran up to her, grabbing her by the hand, and once again dragging her off to play, and within a few minutes Katniss once again became lost in the innocence of childhood. She was only snapped out of it, when she saw Prim, looking sad. Running up to her Katniss could see that she had been crying.

"Hi Catnip.", Prim said, wiping her eyes.

"What's wrong?", Katniss asked.

"It's nothing, im just worried about my sister.", Prim said, making Katniss realize that Posy must have taken her place as Prim's big sister, and was still in the Hunger Games. Knowing there was nothing she could do at the moment to change anything, Katniss did the only thing she could.

"I'm sorry.", Katniss said as she wrapped her arms around Prim's neck, trying to provide comfort to both Prim and herself.

next
1551324111111111.title: Katniss is still 4 years old. In Hawthorne home

15513241111111111.content:
The past couple of weeks had been a bag of mixed emotions for Katniss. As time went on, it became more common for her to slip back into a child like innocence, playing with other children, as well as her new "brothers", and Prim. There was also a lot of embarrassing moments, Hazelle often bathed her, once even Gale had done it. There had even been a couple of moments, where Katniss had nearly thrown a tantrum, before she realized how she was acting and calmed down. Katniss continued to think over how she could return to her normal form and life. Remembering that all the previous times she had changed she had given Posy the necklace, so she hoped that when Posy gave the necklace back to her, things would returned to normal.

She hadn't been allowed to watch Posy in the games, but she was told that Posy was doing well, and to everyone's amazement Posy actually won, even managing to come out with her fellow tribute Peeta, who had confessed his love for her, which to Katniss's surprise, Posy seemed to reciprocate.

Everyone waited at the train station for Posy and Peeta to return. When she arrived Prim had run into her arms. The Hawthornes and the Everdeens had a small gathering that night. As the night wore on Katniss failed to bring up the return of the necklace, and simply spent time with Posy and Prim.

Katniss let out a small yawn as she rested her head on Posy's lap, and snuggled closer.

"She must be tired.", Posy said as she ran her hands through Katniss's hair, then lifted her up. "I'll put her to sleep."

As she was carried to bed, Katniss remembered the necklace, and grabbed onto the pendent.

"Alright time for bed Catnip.", Posy said as she tried to lay her down, but was stopped by the light hold Katniss had on the pendent.

"No.", Katniss sleepily said, not really able to say much else in her tired state.

"Oh you want this back? Sorry, I should have given this back to you sooner.", Posy said, then removed the necklace from around her neck and placed on Katniss, who then allowed Posy to put her down. "Sleep tight.", Posy said placing a kiss on her forehead.

Katniss fell alseep with a smile on her face, hopeful that things would be better tomorrow.

next
15513241111111111.title: Skip Forward to Posy's Return

155132411111111111.content:
As Katniss began to wake up, she could already feel Hazelle's arms around her. Fearing what else could have changed, she closed her eyes, and snuggled closer to her new mother. Posy had given her the necklace back, but she was still in the Hawthorne home, sleeping in the arms of Hazelle. A few minutes later Hazelle awoke and left Katniss laying in bed, while she did some house work. Knowing she could not lay there forever, Katniss sat up and looked towards the mirror that sat on a nearby wall. What she saw shocked her, she was still four years old, but her reflection was no longer her own, now she looked like Posy had before she had first given her the necklace.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/8d/f5/7f/...

While Katniss was shocked, for some reason she was not as upset as she had been previous times she had changed. Because of the time she had already spent in her four year old form, playing with other children, she had become use to it, and had slipped into a child like innocence more and more often.

' I guess this is really it.', Katniss thought as she looked down at the pendent in her hand.

Before she could get off the bed, there was a knock at the door. "Catnip, time to get up.", she heard Gale say.

'At least I still have my name.', Katniss thought. "Coming"

Katniss ran to the kitchen, sitting with her new family, knowing that there was probably no way back, and possibly being ok with it.

next
155132411111111111.title: More has changed

1551324111111111111.content: Not long after that Katniss had turned five again, and had completely excepted her new reality, and as time went on forgot about her teenage life, to her it felt like nothing more than a dream. While having her former appearence, Posy was very different than Katniss had been, she agreed with Gale and actually wanted to fight back against the Capital. During the Quarter Quell, the capital bombed District 12, but luckily, Gale had gotten their family, along with Prim, her mother and many other people out, and escaped to what was once District 13. While Posy and Gale went into battle, Katniss played with her friends, and the other children of District 13. By the end of the war, Posy had uncovered President Coin's plans to continue the hunger games, and had stopped her saving many peoples life. Leading to a happy future, where Katniss did not have to deal with the hardships of her previous life.

1553.content: Alter the History of the Dragon Warrior...or something else?
1553.title: Kung Fu Panda

15532.content:
Oh boy - I bet that a LOT of people have wanted something like this to happen. But this isn't going to be much of a transformation or any other stories on this website. It's not going to be a full length story - cause then it'd be a novel. This is just going to be a synopsis of how episodes 1, 2, and 3 might have been improved.

To start of with - Episode 1 seemed so very distant when going to Episodes 2 and 3. The two latter movies took place only three years apart - where as episode 2 happened 10 years after episode 1. While it might seem strategic, it makes the movie out to be the Black Sheep of the Prequel Trilogy. Compare it with the Original Trilogy - all three movies, in the timeline (not when they were released) were roughly 1 year apart each. So - to make a long story short (too late) I would suggest that perhaps 10 years is a little too long to wait to start a war. So I feel that it should be a maximum of at most 5 years. You may think it might conflict with some issues, but we'll get to those. Now moving onto the movie itself.

Lets face it - McGreggor's portrayal of Obi-Wan in the first movie, seemed a bit too...serious. In the Original Trilogy - older Kenobi did state that when he was young, he too was reckless, like Luke - and evidently, like Anakin. But in Phantom, he seemed to be the Epitome of what Yoda described a Jedi MUST be - with a Deep Commitment and a Most Serious Mind. He did crack a joke every once in a while, but he seemed a bit too stressed out.
I imagine Obi-wan as a Padawan, a lot younger and not as serious - so that Qui-Gon would have to be more of a Mentor to him, having to teach him to be Patient and Serious.

The plot can go relatively the same - but when they land on Naboo - say it with me now - NO JAR-JAR BINKS!!! I'm sorry, I saw Phantom in Theaters when I was six years old, and I thought Jar Jar was hilarious. But lets be honest - Star Wars does NOT need Comic Relief! And Jar-Jar has NOT aged well. Very few of his antics are funny - and even fewer of his words are understandable. So - let's just assume that, since Naboo is part of the Galactic Republic, they would have Registered Knowledge of all species on the planet. So the Jedi land on the Planet and immediately seek out the Gungan City to request help to Warn the Naboo.
Now instead of the Gungan's actually speaking those ridiculous inaudible words, why not have them speak their own Language that comes with Subtitles. And why not explore deeper into the prejudices between the Nabooan and the Gugan - it could be that human beings are the Invasive Species on what used to belong to the Gungans.

So - as the Viceroy and the Droid Army take Theed and capture Amidala - the Jedi race to Theed to rescue the queen. Here's a footnote here - get Amidala a more reasonable dress or fashion sense. Now I know that there's a report out there that 'claims' each of her dresses mean something...but I have trouble accepting that when she clearly has the same Fashion Consultant as Rita Repulsa.
They can escape in relatively the same way - now here is another adjustment that I think is needed - No R2D2 or C-3PO. Like I said, Star Wars doesn't need too much comic relief - and until Return of the Jedi, 3PO only serves as such. I get that R2 does a lot more than him - but the fact that they knew Obi-Wan Kenobi, causes a bit of conflict. Even in old Age, Kenobi would remember the single most reliable Astromech Droid from the Clone Wars. I feel like this should've simply been Obi-Wan and Anakin's story - the presence of Original Trilogy characters like R2 and 3PO, just drags it down. I'd much prefer watching A New Hope and seeing R2 and 3PO more or less as New-Comers in the series - those who heard the legends of the brave Knight Obi-Wan Kenobi, and knew to seek his help.
R2 fans can hate me, but that's the way I see it. That being said - moving on.

They would - of course - have to land on Tatooine to meet with Anakin. Though, I find it a bit confusing cause when charted on a galactic map, Tatooine IS closer to Naboo than Courscant, but it's in the opposite direction, and out of their way. But I suppose, that since the Trade Federation probably doesn't Import goods there, it seemed like the safest sense.

When they land on Tatooine - since Obi-Wan is younger, Qui-Gon would suggest him accompanying them on their journey into Mos Espa to purchase parts. This would allow Obi-Wan to contrast with Padme's cautious attitude. This would cause them to butt-heads on a lot of things, and would form a sort of animosity between them.

Now - regarding Anakin - as even as rough as the 9 year old kid playing him acted, I think he was at least descent as far as child actors go. But, I do wish that Anakin was handled a bit differently - perhaps a bit older. Like I wanted with Obi-Wan to be younger, perhaps in teen years - I also wanted Anakin to be older, into Teen Years as well. That way they would be roughly the same age - with Obi-Wan being the older - and would give them more cause to be rivals. Especially when Qui-Gon begins to notice Anakin's strength in the force.

As for Anakin's family - I personally feel that it was kind of Forced in Episode II that Owen becomes Anakin's Step Brother. Especially when compared to Episode IV - how Owen seemed to know Anakin a lot more than just their one and only meeting. So I was thinking that perhaps Owen could've been Anakin's true brother, or maybe his half-brother. It would provide a contrast - since Owen would not be strong with the force. Now, further regarding Anakin - he can be a good pilot, like Luke and Obi-Wan claimed - but at the time, he doesn't have to know it. And also - he doesn't have to be an inventor. He doesn't build C-3PO - I feel like that was a little TOO much fan-reference; "Darth Vader BUILT C-3PO," now doesn't that sound just wrong?

So like in the film - in order to get the money to purchase the parts for the Hyperdrive Generator, they must compete in a Pod Race. Since a Pod Race requires split-second reflexes, one of the Jedi's must take it. Obi-Wan offers to do it, so that if something goes wrong, the more experienced Qui-Gon, can still protect Amidala. But Qui-Gon, wanting to test his feelings about Anakin, suggests that Anakin do it. Nervous as never pod-raced before, Anakin reluctantly agrees, and discovers his heightened reflexes thanks to his ability to use the force. And like in the movie, they win.

Qui-Gon frees Anakin so that they can take him along. And this would cause Obi-wan to begin to feel jealous of him, now that is surrogate father figure (Qui-Gon is paying all attention to him). Padme understands his jealousy and begins to connect with Obi-Wan more. Suddenly their feelings of Animosity melt away to reveal something more. (Now, I'd personally like to say that I am not in any way a Character Shipper, what-so-ever. I personally think that Padme and Obi-Wan make a rather lousy couple. I am only suggesting this as an improvement, in order to strengthen the burgeoning rivalry with Anakin and Obi-Wan.) However, she does comfort Anakin with his feelings of home-sickness and missing his family - once again making Obi-Wan jealous.

They finally make it to Courscant where all this debating about what to do on Naboo is going on. We meet the Jedi Counsel - except Yoda is either absent and just mentioned, or Yoda is there but, never shown fully. Mace Windu is more the one in charge - and he's upset that Qui-Gon wants to teach Anakin because he's too old. Plus - they're concerned what he's going to do about Obi-Wan. Qui-Gon suggests that Obi-Wan himself is ready to be a Jedi Knight, and can perhaps begin teaching his own Padawan.

Soon we get introduced to Palpetine. It seemed a bit unfair that he got so much power as a Democratically elected official only to become an even more powerful dictator. So instead of him being a Chancellor or Supreme Chancellor, this time he is considered the Middle Man or Third-Party person that handles the dealings between the Politicians and the Jedi Order. That would explain his knowledge of Jedi dealings, and would allow him to manipulate so much more, without being noticed.

And since he is a kind and caring man in public, he gets close to the young padawans - looking for his next potential apprentice. He's had his sights on Obi-Wan for a long time, and feels to be confirmed when he senses a higher concentration in the force. Obi-Wan uses him as a confidant when he expresses his jealousy of Anakin. So, during their time on Courscant, Anakin is allowed to enter Jedi training but at the beginners level. But - Anakin is now a teen in a children's class, so he feels out of place and embarrassed. However when he is shown to have an almost reflex - control of the force of great strength, it's concluded that he is far beyond the beginners level and needs a Master to harness his skills. But as Windu and the Counsel state, Qui-Gon cannot officially train him, however, Windu decides to cut Qui-Gon a break and hints that Qui-Gon can discretely train him, for better control.

As the Bureaucrats in the first movie were completely useless to resolve the Trade Federation Blockade, the Queen decides to do things herself and returns to Naboo - the two Jedi and Anakin accompanying her.
15532.title: The Star Wars Prequels

choices: Episode II; Attack of the Clones part 1
155321.content:
When they land on Naboo - they seek out the help of the Gungans and resolve the prejudiced issues between the two species. It's then revealed that the Gugan's - while believed to be endangered and only surviving in small tribes, have actually been flourishing in secret, and have enough members for an Army. The Gugans us their submersibles to enter the waterways of Theed so that they can mount an attack from the inside and force the droids back, away from the capital. Meanwhile, the two Jedi accompany the queen for the Battle of Theed.

Logically - Qui-Gon would not take young, defenseless, inexperienced, trainee, Anakin into a dangerous situation. But since Anakin has to be featured in the Climax of the film, he can't be left somewhere outside the battle. I imagine that, Qui-Gon would order him to stay in the submarines with some Gungan protectors.

Finally - we catch up with Darth Maul. (since I'm only mentioning the stuff that I change, you can assume that Darth Maul had encountered Qui-Gon Jinn on Tatooine - but I'm also adding a subplot about Maul following them across, Tatooine, waiting to make his move, or for them to reveal where the ship's location is.)
However - instead of diverging off from the Queen and her guardsmen, the duel with Darth Maul takes place alongside them - Maul is so confident in himself that he feels he doesn't need to split the two Jedi up in order to beat them - since Obi-Wan is so young and all. It would be reminiscent of Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein - when Dracula and the Wolfman begin fighting all over the castle, while the two comedians dodge Frankenstein.

Anakin begins to get concerned about Qui-gon and Padme' so he decides to slip past his Gugan protectors and into the palace. That's when he sees that a second squad of Battledroids is moving down the Hallway to ambush the Queen and her guards. So Anakin feels he has to do something and follows. Concentrating hard, he uses the force to loosen some debris from the ceiling and crush the droids - from there, feeling more confident in himself, he hurries to catch up with the others and help some more.

Padme and her guards finally corner Viceroy Gunray, and order him to call off the droid army and surrender. At that moment, the Jedi, dueling with Darth Maul spills over into the throne room. During the distraction - Gunray grabs Padme and holds a gun to her attempting to take her hostage to escape. Because of this, Obi-Wan gets distracted - leaving the duel to Qui-Gon. He uses the force to pull the Gun away from the Viceroy's hand, and the guards completely arrest him. However, during this distraction - Maul outmaneuvers Qui-Gon and kills him. Obi-Wan, realizing his mistake, is shocked. As a result - he attacks Maul in a fit of rage.

Maul takes advantage of his anger and easily over powers him. Maul begins to taunt his younger opponent. He manages to knock Obi-wan to the ground. When he does, Padme goes to help him up. Maul rushes them both, determined to kill Obi-Wan, when suddenly, he is forced to stop. Anakin is revealed to have entered the room, and is now using the force on Darth Maul's entire body, rescuing Obi-wan and Padme. Maul is at first astonished that someone so young could be so strong with the force, but then notices Anakin's anger at seeing Qui-Gon's death. The battle causes some rubble from the roof to fall, distracting Anakin into saving himself and Maul escapes with his life.

Obi-Wan rushes to Qui-Gon's side and with his dying breath, he beseeches Obi-Wan to take care of and train Anakin. Before it's too late, Anakin thanks Qui-Gon for freeing him. Qui-Gon passes - and now, Obi-wan and Anakin are like two orphaned boys who just lost their father. Obi-Wan decides to put aside his jealousy against Anakin now that he had just saved his life.

The Jedi Counsel arrives - joined by Count Dooku, Qui-Gon's old Master. The Viceroy are arrested and taken to Courscant to stand trial. Obi-wan brief's the Order of the situation with Darth Maul, leaving out the information of both he and Anakin loosing their Tempers during the final moments of the fight. For successfully facing the Sith and trusting Qui-Gon's judgement, the Counsel allows Obi-Wan to take the Trials. When Obi-Wan is dismissed, they discuss Anakin - impressed that a young boy could successfully hold off a fully grown Sith, it's decided that regardless of if he is dangerous or not - if the Jedi don't train him, the Sith very much will. It is decided that should Obi-wan pass the Trials, then he shall train Anakin.

But after Qui-Gon's funeral and cremation, Obi-Wan breaks down in his room - distraught at being key to Qui-Gon's downfall, and his fear of facing the trials - no longer believing he is ready. However, he hears Qui-Gon's voice telling him to be strong and that the Force will always be with him. Obi-Wan's sorrows are cured as Qui-Gon Jinn appears before him as a Force Ghost.

Back on Courscant, Darth Maul has successfully escaped and returned to his master - Darth Sideous. He apologizes for having failed on Naboo. Sideous tells him its of no consequence and thanks him for his deeds - by killing Qui-Gon, Obi-Wan will now be consumed with anger and could be tempted to join the dark side. He tells Maul of his plan to make Obi-Wan his next apprentice because he felt a massive Force reading when he met with Obi-Wan. Maul now feels double-crossed that his Master is already making plans to replace him - so in a fit of spite, he elects to not tell Sideous about the true source of the power he sensed - Anakin.

We cut to the Epilogue sometime later - on Naboo, Queen Amidala has had the Gungan Integration Act signed and Gungan's are now welcomed in Nabooian Society. A celebration is held, as the Gungans parade through the streets of Theed. We see Obi-Wan - his Padawan braid severed, and Anakin now sporting a Padawan braid. Padme nervously smiles between the two of them. Like she feels this big decision needs to be made.
The End

--

Now to talk about the smaller things I'd change.
For the one thing - Midichlorians do NOT exist. I understand how having parasites in your body, being lifeforms and all, would allow you to control more of the force around you. BUT - to me, the Force will be nothing more or less than an Energy Field that surrounds us and Penetrates us and binds the universe together. It's energy surrounds us, and binds us - Luminous beings are we, not some crude matter. It is between all things - the wind, the trees, the rocks, the water, the land...and the ship. That being said - the Force is an Energy Field, not Parasites.

Secondly - I feel like the Prequel Trilogy had the Jedi come off as a bunch of stuffy bores. I felt it was not right nor fair that Jedi weren't allowed to love, or feel relatively any emotion at all. I understand that they shouldn't feel fear or anger, but what about the more positive emotions. And I understand that attachment can often lead to bad things and the whole chakra structure stuff. But consider this, just because you can let go of an attachment doesn't mean you don't have to love Something - Avatar 101. They made being a Jedi more of a religion than it should've been. Because - the Jedi are all Knights! And knights are all about chivalry - protection of their Land, their Lord, and their Lady. So if anything, Jedi should not only be allowed to love but encouraged to love. Sure it can be difficult as my rewrite of Episode II will demonstrate - but we'll get to that.

Now the one I've been looking forward to - Darth Maul. For being the only redeeming factor of Phantom Menace he is a VASTLY underused resource. He is an embodiment of evil - he doesn't say much - and to top it all off, he has a Double-Bladed Lightsaber! He killed the man who taught Obi-Wan Kenobi, Obi-Wan's father figure and mentor - that could've been used for so much character development. Now he is Obi-Wan's motivation. He's a personal villain, someone that haunts Obi-Wan, someone he must defeat to regain his honor. It adds so much more for character development.
Which is why I wrote all of it this way - so that we can experience Obi-Wan's growth as well as Anakin's. I'm sorry that Anakin had to take the back seat this time, but I had to have his character do a complete 180 - He was raised a slave, but has so many latent talents, but is to timid and brow-beaten to let them loose. But now that he shows he has power, he will begin to grow more confident in himself.

Obi-Wan to me just came off as a perfect Jedi. I wanted to see him as capable of making more mistakes. So now, instead of being able to fall back on his master, he is now forced from his comfort zone and must be the Master to a new student. But, I also included the reference to Qui-Gon knowing the Immortality Technique and being a ghost at the end, so that technically, his tutelage under Qui-Gon doesn't fully end, because now, he can learn to become, 'More Powerful than can Possibly Imagine.' It sets up NECESSARY plot points for the future Trilogy, instead of focusing on creating the Comic Relief. I hope you enjoyed my Rewrite of Phantom Menace and keep an eye open for my Rewrite of Attack of the Clones.
155321.title: Episode I; The Phantom Menace part 2
