15533.title: More Options.

155332.content:
(I've wanted to do this for a long time. It could essentially be how Dragonball Evolution should've been written. I'm not going to say this is perfect, but it will be better. The problem with DBE is that it tried to be the Origin Story for both Goku and Piccolo, while being the first chapter in a trilogy of DBZ movies followed by the Sayain and Frieza Sagas. But unfortunately, to do this properly would require the movie being much longer, or have prequels. But there is a third option; it's called...Exposition.)

Prologue

Many have heard the incredible feats of Son Goku, the wild boy raised in the wilderness of the East, who journeyed into the West, on a quest to possess the Seven Magical Dragonballs. Created by a Wise old Sage, the Dragonballs were forged with powerful magic and scattered to the corners of the globe. When all seven are brought together, they possess the power to summon the Eternal Dragon, Shenron from his confinement. According to Legend, upon Shenron's release, he will grant one perfect wish to the one who summoned him, as a reward.

Along Goku's journeys to have his wish, he made many loyal friends along the way. Bulma, Yamcha, Korin the Sage, his wise Martial Arts Mentor, Master Mouten Roshi, and of course his fellow trainee and best friend, Krillin. The group traveled with Goku across many adventures all over the world to find the Dragonballs. But where he made friends, he also made enemies.

Goku's legend was built upon the many deeds he'd done in such a young age, and the foes he conquered. There were those who also sought the Dragonballs, to use their magic to conquer the world. Goku triumphed over the wicked Emperor Pilaf. He destroyed the entire Red Ribbon Army, who sought to control the world through industrial war-machines. He dueled and defeated notorious and ruthless master assassin Mercenary Tao. And despite all odds, against any enemy, Goku rose to every challenge.

Over his five year journey, Goku competed in two World Martial Arts Tournaments; a competition of the greatest fighters all over the globe, to see who would be the strongest fighter in the world. While Goku was unable to win either tournament, he was without a doubt one of the most competent contestants. And he vowed to continue his training and become stronger so that he would win the next Tournament...Along the way, he turned many opponents into ally's. Inside the ring, his greatest challenge came from Chiaotzu and Tien Shenhan. Though they began as fierce rivals, the two joined Goku as fierce friends. And despite defeat, every challenge Goku met from a better skilled opponent, always brought a smile to his face.

But Goku's greatest challenge yet soon befell him. It was the return of the evil Demon King Piccolo. He sought to rule the world, boasting his invincibility and power. He hunted down the former tournament contenders and began to eliminate them one by one, so that they wouldn't stand in his way. He even killed Krillin and Master Roshi. He stole the Dragonballs and in a shocking display of power, he killed the Eternal Dragon, destroying the Dragonballs' power. Piccolo was Goku's deadliest opponent, and it took all that Goku had within him to strike the demon king down. But Goku succeeded and cemented himself as the legendary hero of the world.

But shortly after Piccolo's defeat, Goku vanished from the world. It was said that he was last seen seeking wisdom from Korin the Sage. And with Korin's help, Goku ascended into the Heavens to seek continue his training with the Gods and bargain for the lives of his fallen comrade. And so, the Hero of the World left the world. And over the next three years, his legend grew. It is rumored that he is still in Heaven, training with God himself, becoming stronger and stronger. And when at last the day comes when the world is threatened with new Evil, Goku will descend from on-high and save us all...
155332.title: Dragonball Evolution

1553321.content:
"...Now many who hear this story are skeptical of Goku's feats," the old man telling the story at a bar surrounded by other half-soused patrons, continued. "They do not deny the existence of King Piccolo - he was all over the news when he threatened King Doggy for control of the world. They doubted that Goku - who was only fifteen at the time could do it. And they definitely deny Goku ascending into the Heavens to bargain with God for his friends' lives. Especially considering that several eye witnesses claim to have seen both Krillin and Mouten Roshi still alive today; thinking that they never died at all. But still, there are those out there that, when faced with this evidence...only believe Goku's legend even more...Now isn't that a story worth the hearing?"

The old man lifted the tall beer mug to his face, the white foam clinging to his very long white beard and mustache. The others who were listening to his story looked around at each other. "Well I'd say it was when you first told us this story two months ago," one Patron said. The others began laughing and patting each other on the back.

"There's still something I'm confused about," another drunk asked. "You said Goku sought the Dragonballs seeking his own wish, but his enemies ended up stealing the Dragonballs and we assume the wish as well. Did Goku ever have his own wish granted?"

"No actually," the old man told them before adjusting his dark sunglasses. "The truth is, Goku was never after the Dragonballs to grant his own wish. But the reason he collected them was because his new friends wanted to. Goku always made sure to come along to keep an eye on his most sacred treasure. Passed down from his grandfather Son Gohan, Goku was the owner of the Four-Star Dragonball. When his grandfather died, Goku kept it as a reminder of him. Whenever a wish was granted, he always made it a point to recover the Four-Star ball first. But when Piccolo killed his friends, he knew that his one wish would be to revive all of the people that Piccolo and his demon spawn killed before they were defeated. That was Goku's wish...And now, everyone who lost their lives to Piccolo and his minions, is alive and well. Now...It's rumored that God revived Shenron and the Dragonballs are out there, to this very day, waiting to be found."

"How do you know so much about Goku's grandfather? Why would he just happen to have a legendary Dragonball?" one of the patrons asked.

"Why? Because I GAVE it to him of course," the old man boasted as he wiped the beer suds from his Hawaiian shirt. "Gohan was my student. In our youth, he came to me and I taught him everything he knew about Martial Arts. It's why Goku came to me, to complete his training!"

The barflies began laughing at the old man's antics. "Oh really? And why would you just happen to have a mythical Magical orb that no one ever heard of before? And why would you just give it to your student?"

"I had TWO of them," the old man said. "They were a symbol of the completion of my training, and my Master gave them to me as gifts. Just as I gave one to my student as a symbol of his training! I gave him the Four-Star ball and I kept the One-Star Ball. Goku found me when he was searching for all Seven."

"And I thought he came to you to complete his training," one of them said. The drunken men began to slowly stand up, still laughing. One turned and slapped the old man over the shoulder. "Keep telling stories Old Man," he said, giggling to himself as he walked off.

The old man became sad and quietly muttered into his beer mug. He lifted it up and drank from it, finally finishing his beer. He lamented quietly, knowing that these were the reasons why he became a reclusive hermit. His beer was finished. He slowly stood up, propping himself up with a large oak staff. He clung to it, balancing himself for support. He slowly walked to the bar to pay his tab. "Good night," he told the bartender.

On his way for the exit, he tripped and stumbled into a young waitress. She caught him and helped him stand up. "Are you alright sir? Do you need any help?" she asked, being polite as possible. He old man gained his composure and got a clear look at the soft surface he'd fallen against. He suddenly realized how busty this young waitress was. When he fell, his head brushed into her vast endowments. He blushed and smiled at her.

"Oh yes, I'm fine young ma'am," he said. But then he tilted his sunglasses to reveal his eyes to her. "But I think I may need some help getting home. Why don't you come home with me and tuck me into bed? Hehe."

The waitress recoiled in disgust when he started flirting with her. She tried to be as polite as possible, but it was still uncomfortable. "You're not going to drive home, are you?" she asked.

"Oh no...I'll catch a ride from a friend...But there is room for two," he persisted. "I own my own island y'know."

"That's nice," she said as she stood him upright. She left him as quickly as she could. He didn't mind watching her go; the view of her backside was pleasant. But then he remembered that, she is still leaving as fast as she can. He somberly began to saunter toward the door. He stepped out onto the cold night street.

He walked down the street, the only noise was the thump of his walking stick and the tiny taps of his footsteps. He soon came to the docks and walked past the warehouses toward one of the piers. However, he soon began to notice that there was another sound; a subtle one, hidden under his own walking. He stopped and quietly listened. He heard footsteps approaching him. There was more than one pair. At least three of them; they were coming at him from all around. He took a deep breath and sighed. Before long, the old man found himself surrounded by a trio of sailor thugs. They looked like they were preparing to mug him.

"Hey old man!" one of them said. "We've been watching you. Every day you show up at that bar and throw tons of cash around. Looks like you've got some pretty deep pockets."

"Boys, it's been a long night, and I've had a lot to drink," the old man said. "Do we really have to do this now?"

"And that's when we realized who you were...You're Jackie Chun, that guy who won the grand prize from the 21st World Martial Arts tournament a couple of years ago. you're in disguise, but we know it's you...We're willing to bet that you're just drinking your prize money away. What a waste...That money would be better off with us, wouldn't you say?"

The old man stood there quietly. He began to chuckle to himself. "So you found me out, eh?" he asked. "So you plan to beat and rob a martial arts champion?"

"We had to wait for you to get soused up. You can barely stand," one of the muggers said.

"Clever," the old man responded. "But...regardless, now that you know who I am, you should be afraid of me. But more than that...My closest friends know me by another name. And if you knew that name...You'd be even more terrified of me."

The trio suddenly rushed toward him. The old man, ducked down, causing the three of them to inadvertently strike each other. He then punched the man in front of him and kicked the one behind. The third man took a swing at the tiny old geezer. But the old man jumped into the air and avoided the attack. When he came back down, he smacked the thug over the head with his staff. He then raised his leg and kicked him off to the side. Another attacker got up and attacked him from behind. The old man soon turned and jabbed his staff toward the mugger, striking vital pressure points before knocking him away. The third and final mugger tried to attack one last time. The old man leaped through the air and kicked the attacker in the chest. When he landed he began making several quick strikes to his attacker's chest before striking him with his palm. The attack sent the thug flying down the street.

The old man stood there, surveying the situation and seeing his work. He noted how none of his opponents were getting up. They seriously underestimated him. He smiled and began to slowly trek toward the pier again. He finally he stood at the edge of the dock. He was teetering slightly from the alcohol. He decided to sit on a small crate sitting on the edge of the dock. He sat quietly and pondered, lightly tapping his walking stick on the wooden pier. He looked down and slowly began to reach inside of his jacket.

He pulled something out of his breast pocket. He turned his hand to reveal a glowing amber orb. There was a light that glowed inside it, like a fire. And floating around, like particles in a snow globe or oil in a lava lamp, was a single red star. It was a Dragonball! The old man looked at the glow it gave of. He covered it with his hand and lifted it to his chest, holding it right over his heart.
"...Thank you Goku," he said, as in in a prayer. That somehow speaking to the Dragonball, Goku could hear him, where ever he was. "We owe everything to you...Without you, I and so many others would not be here today." The old man looked as though he were ready to break into tears. "But we do wish you were here with us...Life just hasn't been the same without you, my boy. But if you are in Heaven for us...Then it is a much greater place because of you."
1553321.title: The Old Master

15533211.content:
"Oh my dear Goku," the old man continued to pray. "You truly were my greatest student. And yet not even I could prepare you for the tribulations. But I would never ask you to take that task for your own...You chose it for yourself. And by Jove, you were amazing. I was never more amazed nor more proud than when Bulma told me what you did that day. To have seen you strike the killing blow to the evil King...would've been such a treat and pleasure before I died, that Death would've seemed like a welcome comfort. My life would be complete. But I couldn't see it...Hehe...I was already dead. I was a fool Goku...But even more of a fool that I couldn't protect you from this task because of my arrogant pride. I knew exactly what I was dealing with...I wonder, if given the chance; would I do things differently? I do envy you Goku...You have achieved what could be the greatest accomplishment a student can; you made your master proud. A satisfaction that I too tried to achieve when I faced Piccolo; to honor my master...Mutaito."

The old man looked up to the night sky and began to recollect a memory from his youth. He saw himself as he was nearly fifty years ago when Piccolo first rose to power. He was a young man then, only eighteen. He was arrogant and he was brash. He and Chen had completed their training under Master Mutaito years before...But their master requested their presence to answer the threat of the Invasion. When Piccolo began his campaign, the three of them stood against him. Mutaito fought Piccolo himself and told his students to not interfere under any circumstances. The two of them battled throngs of Piccolo's minions. While they were able to triumph, their poor master was beaten by the Demon King.

The three of them were forced to retreat, and Piccolo conquered the world. The three of them went into hiding with the intent of forming the resistance. But Mutaito left them. He told them that he was leaving on a journey to discover a way to stop Piccolo, and that he would return. In his absence, Piccolo decimated most of the human population on the planet. And Chen soon lost faith in his master, and left. He broke all bonds with friends, and became Crane Hermit, perusing a career of darkness, and immorality.
Two years passed and Piccolo ruled his dark empire...It seemed to be hopeless for the world. And then one day, Mutaito returned. He said he'd found a way to stop Piccolo once and for all. Student and Master once again prepared to stop the Demon King.

"PICCOLO!" Mutaito shouted. "Show yourself! Step forward and be counted for all of the crimes you've committed!"

The two of them stood against a huge army of Piccolo's minions. They were surrounded by green-skinned monsters with wings, sharp fangs and claws, and all wearing the word "Devil" on their Clothes - it was their Master's symbol. Then finally, the demons parted, and their king stepped forward. He was a monstrous giant that towered over them all. Clad in black robes, wearing a blood-red cape. His face green, wrinkled and ugly like a Goblin. His eyes glowing yellow. He grinned when he saw us.

"I remember you," Piccolo said. "You're the Peace-seeking fools who challenged us once before. Are you here to bring Justice upon me? Fine then...If you so wish, I will make you dance just like last time!"

Mutaito took the package he'd been carrying and gently laid it on the ground. He undid the wrappings to reveal that the weapon he intended to use, was little more than an electric rice cooker. It was an unremarkable green pot, with little else changed about it, save for the seal stamped to the side. Mutaito opened the top and slowly stood up.

"Oh? And what is this old man?! You intend to cook us lunch before we fight?" Piccolo laughed. "My children will be more than happy to feast on your flesh!"

"Mouten," Mutaito told his student. The young man turned toward his master. "When I complete what I intend to do...there is a good chance that I might not be able to fight anymore. When it happens, you must close the pot as quickly as you can...And when it is closed, you must protect it at all costs."

"Uh but Master," the young student exclaimed. "There's so many of them...I...I can't defeat them alone."

"Mouten," Mutaito slowly turned to face his student. His white hair and mustache never looked more reassuring. "You...are one of my greatest students. It has been an honor and a privileged to be your mentor, teacher, and friend. I have long since regarded you as the bravest young man I have ever known. I have the utmost faith in you, that you will carry out this task. Without their master, the hordes of demons will be lost and confused. They will fall easily by your hands. And when you triumph...take the pot and throw it into the darkest depths that you can find."

"I will, Master," the young man replied.

Mutaito turned back toward King Piccolo. "Goodbye...Mouten Roshi," he said. Suddenly the old master was bathed in a green light. Piccolo fired a Ki blast from his hand. But it washed off of Mutaito; he was completely unharmed. Piccolo grimaced and fired more. But none of them worked. Finally, Mutaito threw his arms forward. "EVIL CONTAINMENT WAVE!!!"

A green vortex fired from Mutaito's hands and engulfed Piccolo. The demon king was drawn into the spiral and was sucked along with the waves. Mutaito directed his hands downward toward the rice cooker. The green waves poured into the pot until all had traveled inside. Obeying his Master's wishes, the young student rushed forward and closed the lid of the pot. The force of the waves was holding off the lid - he could feel something trying to get out with all its might. But the young man managed to close the lid. The Demon King Piccolo was gone, trapped inside of the jar for what they would assume was forever.

"Master! You did it! He's gone!" the young man looked up and said to his Master. But his joy soon faded as he saw Mutaito struggle to stand. The old master slowly tipped over and fell to the ground. Using the Evil Containment wave had drained all of his energy. Master Mutaito was dead; his life given in defense of the planet. The young student mourned, and closed the old man's eyes.

The army of demons were confused at the sudden disappearance of their King. They spotted the rice cooker. Soon they began to rush for it. The young student remembered the final task his master had given him. He stood and protected the jar from the hordes of demons. The battle lasted for hours, and against the sheer numbers, fighting pain and fatigue, the young master defeated them all, and triumphed in the face of insurmountable evil. The battle was witnessed by the survivors who had emerged from their hiding places to see a young man - alone - standing against Piccolo's army and defeating them. When the army was finished, the young man was hailed as a hero, and the crowds chanted his name.

But he cared not for their praise. He had one last task to complete. He picked up the Rice Cooker and traveled to the ocean. He chartered a ship to carry him to the deepest part of the darkest sea. And so there, above the Abysmal Trench, he cast the Pot into the ocean, hoping to never see King Piccolo again. The young man soon established himself as the Turtle Hermit, and began to teach students of his own, to honor the memory of his fallen Master who saved the entire world.

--

The old man snapped out of his memories. He opened his eyes and looked out at the rolling sea in the night sky. "Yes...It was a hope...But we were wrong. I thought he'd forever be entombed at the bottom of the sea. I'm sorry Goku," the old man lamented. "You and Krillin had to pay the price for my mistake." He slowly began to stand up. He took a deep breath and shouted, "HEY! BABY GAMERA! COME HERE!"

His words echoed out, until there was silence. But before long a strange spinning saucer appeared out of the water. It landed on the dock before the old man. It soon revealed to be an enormous turtle.
"You need a ride back home?" the turtle asked.

"Yes," the old man said. He slowly began to climb aboard the Turtle's shell. "Also...I've had a lot to drink tonight, so I'm already nauseous. So, no spinning. Fly straight if you can.

"Alright; hang on," the turtle said. The turtle retracted its legs and fire began to shoot out of the shell like rocket engines. Soon the turtle flew through the air with the old man riding on its back. The turtle carried him out to sea, but the trip was a short one. Several hundred miles off the coast was a small atoll with a single house on it. The turtle began to descend.

"Thank you Gamera," the old man said. He climbed off the turtle's back. "Good night." The old man walked for the door as the turtle crawled back into the sea. He looked up at the door. The words 'Kame House' written in red letters across the front. He quietly entered and walked into his living room. He found his best friend, an enormous brown sea turtle sitting there, watching TV. "Hello Turtle."

"Master, you're home early tonight," the turtle said. "Launch is cooking dinner."

"Is he home?" they heard a feminine voice call to them. Soon a young woman with blue hair, wearing an apron over her clothes appeared. "Oh, hello Master Roshi. So glad you can back so soon; dinner is almost ready."

"Thank you Launch," Roshi told her. He moved to sit down on the couch and wait for dinner to be finished.

"Now let's see, let's just add a bit of pepper and -" they heard Launch say. Hearing that, Roshi and Turtle got really nervous. They could hear Launch preparing to sneeze. "Ah-Aaah-Achoo!" The two of them froze. They soon heard the clicking and subsequent popping of two capsules opening. Suddenly Launch appeared from the kitchen, her hair now blonde and her expression mean. She was holding a machine gun. "Make me cook for you old man?! Make me wear an apron will ya?!" She began firing as Roshi and Turtle hit the floor.

"Yup, never a dull moment with her around," Roshi said.
15533211.title: The Fall of the Demon King

1553322.content:
(For some reason, I had the strangest desire to start the story over; I guess that's what Total Rewrite is FOR.)

On the serene and unassuming Mount Paozu, the silence of the morning air was broken by the roar of powerful motorbikes. The first zoomed along the mountain road, as quickly as it could; it's rider was a young woman, her blue hair pulled back into a pony-tail. She looked very frightened. Her bike was far ahead of a pack of motorcycles, each being driven by undesirable looking fellows; all burly and unclean.

The young woman glanced over her shoulder back at them. It was obvious that they were pursuing her and intended to do her harm. She accelerated her machine in a vane attempt to outrun them, but she could not increase the distance. And even more unfortunate, one of them was now closing the gap. He pulled up his bike along side her and began swinging a lead pipe toward her bike. The young woman swerved to the right to dodge the oncoming attack. She then veered hard to the left again, smashing her bike against his, causing him to lose control, and the bike to tumble and fall back.
Unfortunately the confrontation caused the gang to catch up on her yet again. She was getting desperate; if they caught her, they would do horrible and unspeakable things to her. She looked off to her right and could only see mountain forest. It was quite thick, but she was certain she could navigate through the trees.

She immediately stopped the bike and hopped off. As soon as she did, she ran off into the woods, ducking tree branches and slipping through them as quickly as she could. The bikers all stopped and followed her into the woods.

--

A secluded lake in a clearing of the mountain was the home of enormous Paozu Tuna. The lake was calm and tranquil, the surface unbroken. Suddenly the surface broke when an enormous Tuna-Fish was flung from the water onto the shores nearby. A small figure soon follows the fish, slowly emerging from the water and walking onto the shore. The mysterious fisherman soon adorned his purple gi that he'd left on the shore before he entered the water. Now that he was out on the surface, he suddenly heard the roar of the motorcycle engines down the mountain. He turned his head toward the sound; he'd never heard anything like it.

--

The young woman ran through the woods, her legs pumping as hard as they could to keep sprinting. Her denim short-shorts and jacket were absorbing so much sweat. She was beginning to get fatigued. She could hear her pursuers coming up from behind. She was beginning to get more worried; up ahead the morning fog had grown thicker. She could barely see which direction she was going.
Soon she began to hear the sound of running water. And it became more prominent as she broke into a clearing. The fog had cleared only just enough to reveal that she's run to the edge of a lagoon, being fed by a waterfall. A waterfall from the top of a large rock wall. And the woman now realized how desperate her situation was. This was a dead end, and she couldn't possibly climb it...She was trapped.

She turned around defiantly as her pursuers appeared. She panted hard as the group of thugs began to spread out in an attempt to surround her. The largest and toughest of the group smiled a sinister grin at her through his thick black beard. She began to suspect he was the gang's leader.
"Bulma Briefs," he said with a gruff and surly voice. "Imagine our surprise when we saw the Capsule Corps Heiress all the way out here...and all alone."

"How much is she worth, Boss?" one of them asked.

"Capsule Corps is the biggest company on the planet; her family is worth billions," the leader said. "I'm sure her old man will be quite compliant when he hears we have his little-girl."

Bulma cringed and furrowed her brow. These thugs were planning to kidnap her and hold her for ransom. All things considered, it could've been a lot worse; but she was Bulma Briefs - one of the most brilliant and strong willed young women on the face of the planet. She was NOT going to give into this. Besides, if these guys did kidnap her, she wouldn't be able to complete her mission; and she'd worked so hard already.

"Well guys; let's get Mrs. Briefs out of here and show her some of our generous hospitality," the Leader said. With that the men began converging on her. "Now, come quietly and this won't have to get rough."

The sunlight was beginning to pierce the fog bank as the thugs closed in on Bulma. Suddenly the leader found himself standing in a shadow. He raised his head in just enough time to see an enormous Paozu Tuna flying right toward him. It suddenly crashed into him, pinning him to the ground. The group, including Bulma all gave a light jump when the fish slammed into him.

"Boss, are you okay?!" one of them asked. However while their eyes were locked on the enormous fish that kept their leader pinned, one of them was suddenly knocked to the ground completely unconscious.

"UGH!" he grunted after being struck over the head. The group turned around in enough time to see a figure disappear into the shadows after attacking their fellow biker. Suddenly the figure reappeared, jumping out of the forest and striking another of them in the face. Suddenly the remaining group members converged on this figure, all attacking him at once. Bulma was surprised by this turn of events; she could just barely make out what was happening through the fog, but she could infer that whoever this person was, he was succeeding in fighting them off.

The mystery warrior defended himself using a kind of staff, holding off their clubs and lead pipes as they swung toward him. He moved so quickly, dodging their attacks that they began to swing wildly...It didn't help, and it only succeeded in their defeat. The fighter was able to easily overpower and outmaneuver each of them, screeching like some kind of wild animal as he did. Soon, each one of them was knocked down.

Bulma spotted her mysterious savior perched on a rock near the edge of the lagoon. He was still shrouded in fog and darkness that she couldn't make him out. However suddenly, the leader of the thugs recovered and began to stand, lifting the enormous fish off of his body and tossing it aside. He looked very angry. He picked up one of the abandoned lead pipes and charged toward the fighter.

The mystery person leaped off the rock and rushed forward to fight him with his staff. The two of them exchanged blows for a moment before the figure parried the lead pipe away. The gang leader tried to strike at him, only to be dodged before receiving an incredibly strong strike to the face. The figure then twirled his staff around and smacked the gang leader with it. he hit him with enough force to knock the man into the lagoon where he made a splash.

Bulma shrieked and covered herself when the wave of water came toward her. She moved away from the lagoon and began to lean against one of the trees. She breathed heavily and tried to calm herself down. She looked back toward the scene. She saw that her mystery savior was perched on a rock above the scene, the morning light now piercing through the fog, enough to silhouette his form.
She suddenly realized how tiny this person was; smaller than she was...he was just a boy. His hair was incredibly large and spiky. He raised his staff and triumphantly tapped one end into the rock. And then Bulma suddenly spotted it, rising out from the boy's back was a furry tail! Who was this person?

She could tell he was looking at her. "Uh...Hello?" she asked. "Uh...Thank you for...saving me."

Suddenly he leaped off the rock and came toward her, pointing one end of his staff at her. She was so startled that she put her hands in the air, submissively. "Uh okay...okay, just...don't do anything crazy."

Being up close she finally got a good look at the boy. He was indeed a young child, maybe 10 or 11. He wore a purple training gi. He had a round face and wide eyes. He didn't seem to want to hurt her; he seemed more cautious of her. He slowly began to circle her. She scowled at him as he went around behind her, not wanting any funny business from him. When he came back around, he seemed less cautious, and more curious.

"What kind of creature are you?" the boy asked.

Bulma raised an eyebrow at that comment. "What do you mean, "creature"?" she asked. Then she thought a moment. This boy had a tail, and was able to fight off five grown men, all the while screeching like a monkey. He was probably a feral child who had lived out here all alone. She was probably the first female he'd ever seen in his entire life. "...Are...you alone up here?" she asked.

The boy jabbed his staff at her again. "No; I live here with my Grandpa!" he said. "And he told me to always be weary of the creatures that live in this forest."

"Oh...I suppose then you've never seen a girl before," Bulma said.

"A girl?" the boy asked. He slowly lowered his staff. "Grandpa told me to always be nice to girls." He suddenly began to bow toward her. "Please pardon me."

Bulma smiled, knowing that this boy wasn't truly feral and had some manners. "It's alright, considering you did save me from those guys."

"Still, Grandpa says that we should always extend our hospitality to girls," the boy said. He suddenly turned around and walked toward the tuna. He grabbed its tail and began to drag the fish behind him. "Follow me; my home is this way."

Bulma wasn't sure she was interested in following him. However, she soon heard a beeping sound from a round device she kept on her belt. She took it off to examine it; it's large green screen with a coordinate plane showed an orange circle off further in the mountains. It was in the direction the boy was going. Bulma figured she might as well not waste the opportunity. She began to follow, not knowing where this adventure would leave her.
1553322.title: Dragonball; the Legend Begins

info.brief_description: Change the reality of anime, video game, TV show, etc. however you desire.
info.description:
Just follow the usual rules about grammar and sticking with the rating and you should do fine.

In this interactive, you pick something you know and love and then change the fabric of its reality. The characters may or may not notice this. This is not, I repeat "not", limited to transformations, although that also works here. Be welcome to be nutty with the changes.
